Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the company by the Minister of National Revenue; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its expected date of importation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its unique identification number, make, model and model year and the name of the engine manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the engine is installed in a machine, the type of machine, the name of the machine manufacturer and the machine’s make and model,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any applicable emission families,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement as to whether or not the engine

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is covered by an EPA certificate,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: belongs to an emission family that includes engines that are sold concurrently in Canada and the United States,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: bears the national emissions mark, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: is a replacement engine,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: as applicable, a statement that the engine

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is an engine referred to in subsection 12(1), 13(1), 14(1), 15(1) or 16(1), (2) or (3), as the case may be, and conforms to the alternative standards referred to in that subsection, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: is a compression-ignition engine that powers an emergency machine,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: as applicable, a statement that the company

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: is able to provide the required evidence of conformity, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: has provided the required evidence of conformity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: as applicable,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a statement that the required evidence of conformity is retained at a place of business of the company and, if that place of business is located at a place other than the street address referred to in paragraph (a), the street address of that place of business, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a statement that the required evidence of conformity is retained at a location other than a place of business of the company and the name and telephone number of a contact person at that location and the street address and, if different, the mailing address of that location.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the declaration must be signed by an authorized representative of the company and submitted to the Minister before the engine is imported.

A company that imports 50 engines or more during a calendar year may submit the declaration after importation — but no later than March 31 of the calendar year following the calendar year during which the engines are imported — if, before importing the first of those engines, the company submits a notice to the Minister that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the company’s name, street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, email address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the company;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the company by the Minister of National Revenue; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the company will import 50 engines or more during the calendar year.

Subsection.Text: The notice referred to in subsection (3) is only required to be submitted in respect of the first calendar year during which the company imports engines in reliance on that subsection.
Subsection (3) does not apply in respect of replacement engines.

Section.MarginalNote: Declaration — person that is not a company

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 153(1)(b) of the Act, a person that imports an engine and that is not a company must make a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name, email address, telephone number, street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, email address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the person, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the person by the Minister of National Revenue, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the engine’s unique identification number, make, model and model year and the name of the engine manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating whether the engine is a compression-ignition engine or a large spark-ignition engine;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the engine is installed in a machine, the type of machine, the name of the machine manufacturer and the machine’s make and model; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the engine bears

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the national emissions mark,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the label referred to in subsection 28(1) or (2) or 29(1) or (2), paragraph 30(a) or 31(a) or section 33, as applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the United States emission control information label referred to in paragraph 30(b) or 31(b) or section 32, as applicable, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a label showing that the engine conformed to the emission standards of the California Air Resources Board that are in effect at the time its manufacture was completed.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the declaration must be signed by the person or by their authorized representative and submitted to the Minister before the engine is imported.

The declaration in respect of each of the first through ninth engines that a person imports during a calendar year may be submitted to the Minister before the person imports a tenth engine during that calendar year, instead of before the importation of each engine. If the person does not import a tenth engine, a declaration is not required in respect of the first through ninth engines.
A company may only import an engine in reliance on subsection 153(2) of the Act if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine’s manufacture will be completed in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the company is authorized to apply the national emissions mark to the engine and will apply it after importation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine is a replacement engine and the engine that it will replace will only be identified after importation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the company makes a declaration to the Minister in accordance with this section.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the declaration must be submitted before the engine is imported, be signed by an authorized representative of the company and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the company’s name, street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, email address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the company;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the company by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of engines that the company intends to import in reliance on subsection 153(2) of the Act, the name of the manufacturer and the unique identification number, make, model and model year of the engines, as well the applicable emission families;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any engines that are installed in a machine, the name of the machine manufacturer and the make, model and type of machine;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine, a statement, as applicable, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine’s manufacture will be completed in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the company is authorized to apply the national emissions mark to the engine and will apply it at the location specified in their application under section 26, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine is a replacement engine;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the company makes the statement referred to in subparagraph (f)(i),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement from the manufacturer of the engine that the engine will, when completed in accordance with instructions provided by the manufacturer, conform to the requirements prescribed under these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement from the company that the engine will be completed in accordance with the instructions referred to in subparagraph (i);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the company makes the statement referred to in subparagraph (f)(ii),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authorization number assigned to it by the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the street address of the location where the engine will be kept until the national emissions mark is applied to it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the measures that will be taken to ensure that the engine does not leave the company’s possession or control before the national emissions mark is applied to it; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the company makes the statement referred to in subparagraph (f)(iii),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the street address of the location where the engine will be kept until the evidence of conformity referred to in subsection 41(1) has been submitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the measures that will be taken to ensure that the engine does not leave the company’s possession or control before the evidence of conformity is submitted.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an engine that is covered by an EPA certificate and meets either of the following conditions, the company may make a declaration that contains the information set out in paragraphs (4)(d) and 44(1)(a) to (d) instead of the information set out in paragraphs (2)(a) to (i):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the engine will have its manufacture completed in Canada by the addition of an emission control system for exhaust emissions, or part of such a system, in a manner that conforms to the certificate and the certificate holder’s installation instructions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the engine will have its manufacture completed in Canada by the addition of a complete fuel system, or part of such a system, in a manner that conforms to the certificate and the certificate holder’s installation instructions.

Subsection.Text: A company that imports 50 engines or more during a calendar year may submit the declaration referred to in subsection (3) after importation — but no later than March 31 of the calendar year following the calendar year during which the engine is imported — if, before importing the engine, the company submits a notice to the Minister that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the company’s name, street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, email address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the company;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the company by the Minister of National Revenue; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the engine is covered by an EPA certificate and will, as applicable, have its manufacture completed in Canada by the addition of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an emission control system for exhaust emissions, or part of such a system, in a manner that conforms to the certificate and the certificate holder’s installation instructions; or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a complete fuel system, or part of such a system, in a manner that conforms to the certificate and the certificate holder’s installation instructions.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 155(1)(a) of the Act, the declaration to be made by a person importing an engine must contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name, email address, telephone number, street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person’s authorized representative, if any, and their email address and telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the person by the Minister of National Revenue, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of whether the person intends to import compression-ignition engines, large spark-ignition engines or both;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a written statement that the engine will be used in Canada solely for purposes of exhibition, demonstration, evaluation or testing;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the engine will be imported;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date by which the engine will be removed from Canada or destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the engine’s unique identification number, make, model and model year and the name of the engine manufacturer; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the engine is installed in a machine, the type of machine, the name of the machine manufacturer and the machine’s make and model.

Subsection.Text: The declaration must be signed by the person or by their authorized representative and submitted to the Minister before the engine is imported. However, in the case of a person that imports more than 50 engines during a calendar year, the declaration may be submitted quarterly.

Section.Text: Any declaration required under these Regulations and any declaration required under paragraph 155(1)(a) of the Act must be submitted electronically in a format provided by the Minister, but the declaration must be submitted in writing if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no format has been provided; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is, owing to circumstances beyond the control of the person required to submit the declaration, impracticable to submit the declaration electronically in the format provided.

Heading.TitleText: Maintenance, Retention and Submission of Records

Subsection.Text: A company must maintain records, in writing or in a readily readable electronic or optical form, that contain the following information in relation to an engine:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence of conformity referred to in section 40 or 41, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any declaration made under subsection 44(1) or paragraph 46(1)(b) and any notice submitted under subsection 44(3);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the engine’s unique identification number includes characters that provide information in respect of the engine’s manufacture, the means by which to interpret those characters to obtain that information; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any written instructions required under sections 36 to 39.

Subsection.Text: The records must be retained for a period of eight years beginning on any one of the following days, as applicable:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a), (c) and (d),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the engine is manufactured in Canada, the last day of the calendar year that corresponds to the model year of the engine, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the engine is imported, the day on which it is imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the information referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the day on which the declaration is made.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 155(6) of the Act, the record maintained by a person who makes a declaration referred to in paragraph 155(1)(a) of the Act must include a copy of the declaration and documents evidencing the use of the engine in Canada and its disposition and must be kept as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the declaration,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy must be kept in writing with the engine until it is disposed of, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy must be kept in writing or in a readily readable electronic or optical form at the person’s place of business for a period of eight years beginning on the day on which the engine was disposed of; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the documents evidencing the use of the engine in Canada and its disposition, a copy must be kept in writing or in a readily readable electronic or optical form at the person’s place of business for a period of eight years beginning on the day on which the engine was disposed of.

Subsection.Text: If the records referred to in subsection (1), subparagraph (3)(a)(ii) or paragraph (3)(b) are retained at a location other than a place of business of the company or person, the company or person must keep a record of the name and telephone number of a contact person at that location and the street address and, if different, the mailing address of that location.
If the Minister makes a written request for a record referred to in subsection (1), the record must be submitted to the Minister in either official language

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 40 days after the day on which the request is made; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the record must be translated from a language other than English or French, within 60 days after the day on which the request is made.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 153(1)(h) of the Act, the registration system maintained by a company in respect of the engines that it manufactures or imports must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number of each engine that is equipped with an auxiliary emission control device referred to in subsection 7(2) that meets the requirements set out in paragraph 7(2)(e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine referred to in paragraph (a), if available,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of requests received by the company or on the company’s behalf for the reset of the auxiliary emission control device and, for each request, a summary of the emergency situation in which the auxiliary emission control device was activated, based on the information provided in the request for reset, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of times the auxiliary emission control device has been reset.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an imported engine, the registration system in respect of the engine may be maintained by the manufacturer of the engine on the company’s behalf.

The information included in the registration system in respect of an engine must be retained for a period of eight years beginning on the day on which the engine is imported or its manufacture is completed.

If the registration system is retained at a location other than a place of business of the company, the company must keep a record of the name and telephone number of a contact person at that location as well as the street address and, if different, the mailing address of that location.

Section.Text: The annual rental rate to be paid to a company by the Minister under subsection 159(1) of the Act, prorated on a daily basis for each day that an engine is made available, is 12% of the manufacturer’s suggested retail price for the engine.

A company applying under section 156 of the Act for an exemption from conformity with any standard prescribed under these Regulations must, before manufacturing or importing the engine, submit the following information in writing to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the company’s name and street address and, if different, mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, email address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the company;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the province or country under the laws of which the company is established;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the standards from which an exemption is sought, including a reference to the provisions of these Regulations that prescribe the standards;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the duration requested for the exemption;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the estimated number of engines for which the exemption is sought and an estimate of the changes in emissions if the exemption is granted;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for requesting the exemption, including technical and financial information that demonstrates in detail why conformity to the standards referred to in paragraph (d) would

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: create substantial financial hardship for the company,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: impede the development of new features for emission monitoring or emission control that are equivalent or superior to those that conform to prescribed standards, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: impede the development of new kinds of engines or engine systems or components;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the basis of the application is substantial financial hardship,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the world production of engines manufactured by the company or by the manufacturer that is the subject of the application in the 12-month period beginning two years before the start of the exemption period being sought, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total number of engines manufactured for, or imported into, the Canadian market in the 12-month period beginning two years before the start of the exemption period being sought; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the company is requesting that information submitted be treated as confidential under section 313 of the Act, the reasons for the request.

Subsection.Text: The notice of defect referred to in subsections 157(1) and (4) of the Act must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company giving the notice and its street address and, if different, mailing address, and the name, email address, telephone number and, if any, facsimile number of the appropriate contact person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each engine in respect of which the notice is given, its make, model and model year, the name of its manufacturer, the period during which it was manufactured and any applicable emission families;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the range or ranges of unique identification numbers for the engines in respect of which the notice is given, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the machine or type of machine in or on which the engine is installed or is likely to be installed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the total number of engines in respect of which the notice is given or, if the total number is not known, the estimated number;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the estimated percentage of the potentially affected engines that contain the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an evaluation of the pollution risk arising from the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the measures to be taken to correct the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a chronology of the principal events that led to the determination of the existence of the defect, if known; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the means available to the company to contact the current owner of each defective engine.

Subsection.Text: The notice of defect must be given in writing and, when given to a person other than the Minister, must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in both official languages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the person’s official language of choice, if it is known.

Subsection.Text: A company must, within 60 days after giving a notice of defect, submit to the Minister the initial report referred to in subsection 157(7) of the Act containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an update to the information referred to in subsection (1), if there have been any changes to that information;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if not already provided in the notice,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the range or ranges of unique identification numbers for the engines in respect of which the notice is given,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total number of engines in relation to which the notice of defect has been given, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a chronology of the principal events that led to the determination of the existence of the defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: copies of all notices, bulletins and other circulars issued by the company in respect of the defect, including a detailed description of the nature and physical location of the defect with diagrams and other illustrations as necessary.

Subsection.Text: If a company submits an initial report under subsection (3), it must submit, within 45 days after the end of each quarter, a quarterly report to the Minister respecting the defect and its correction that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number, title or other identification assigned by the company to the notice of defect;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the revised number of engines in respect of which the notice of defect was given;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the notice of defect was given to the current owners of the affected engines and the dates of any follow-up communications; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total number or percentage of engines repaired by or on behalf of the company, including engines requiring inspection only.

Subsection.Text: The provisions of the Off-Road Compression-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations set out in column 1 of the table to this subsection, as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force, continue to apply to engines — other than transition engines referred to in subsection (2) — whose manufacture was completed before the day on which these Regulations come into force, instead of the provisions of these Regulations set out in column 2.

entry.Emphasis: Provisions of the Off-Road Compression-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations
Provisions of the Off-road Compression-Ignition (Mobile and Stationary) and Large Spark-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations

Subsection.Text: The provisions of the Off-Road Compression-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations, as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force, continue to apply to transition engines within the meaning of section 13 of those Regulations, instead of the provisions of these Regulations.

For the purposes of this section, a reference in the Off-Road Compression-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations to a provision of the CFR is to be read as a reference to that provision as it read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.

Heading.TitleText: Off-Road Small Spark-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations
Marine Spark-ignition Engine, Vessel and Off-road Recreational Vehicle Emission Regulations

Section.Text: The Off-Road Compression-Ignition Engine Emission Regulations3 are repealed.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), these Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Sections 1 to 25, 28 to 54 and 57 to 78 come into force on the day that, in the sixth month after the month in which these Regulations are registered, has the same calendar number as the day on which they are registered or, if that sixth month has no day with that number, the last day of that sixth month.

Sections 55 and 56 come into force on the day that, in the eighteenth month after the month in which these Regulations are registered, has the same calendar number as the day on which they are registered or, if that eighteenth month has no day with that number, the last day of that eighteenth month.

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The letters EC in large font with a maple leaf pictured inside the letter C.

Section.Text: Subsection 44(2) of these Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the declaration must be signed by an authorized representative of the company and submitted to the Minister before the engine is imported, unless a declaration containing the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) has been submitted to the Canada Border Services Agency using the electronic declaration system made available by the Agency.

Section.Text: Subsection 45(2) of these Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the declaration must be signed by the person or by their authorized representative and submitted to the Minister before the engine is imported, unless a declaration containing the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (g) has been submitted to the Canada Border Services Agency using the electronic declaration system made available by the Agency.
